title: Installation issue: perl (blocks llvm installation)
body:
<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install llvm

[...]

==> Installing perl
==> No binary for perl found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /g/data/jh2/bw0729/spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/32/32e04c8bb7b1aecb2742a7f7ac0eabac100f38247352a73ad7fa104e39e7406f.tar.gz
==> Using cached archive: /g/data/jh2/bw0729/spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/9d/9da50e155df72bce55cb69f51f1dbb4b62d23740fb99f6178bb27f22ebdf8a46.tar.gz
==> Moving resource stage
        source : /scratch/jh2/bw0729/tmp/spack-stage/resource-cpanm-5ug3nuxo2vvgzvgvgz7agevwq6nuxsiq/spack-src/
        destination : /scratch/jh2/bw0729/tmp/spack-stage/spack-stage-perl-5.30.3-5ug3nuxo2vvgzvgvgz7agevwq6nuxsiq/spack-src/cpanm/cpanm
==> perl: Executing phase: 'configure'
==> perl: Executing phase: 'build'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 2:
    'make' '-j16'

75 warnings found in build log:
     153     What is your e-mail address? [bw0729@gadi-login-02.gadi.nci.org.au]
     154     Perl administrator e-mail address [bw0729@gadi-login-02.gadi.nci.org.au]
     155     Do you want to use a version number suffix for installed binaries? [n]
     156     What shall I put after the #! to start up perl ("none" to not use #!)?
     157     [/g/data/jh2/bw0729/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-skylake_avx512/gcc-8.3.1/perl-5.30.3-5ug3nuxo2vvgzvgvgz7
             agevwq6nuxsiq/bin/perl]
     158
  >> 159     WARNING:  Some systems limit the #! command to 32 characters.
     160     If you experience difficulty running Perl scripts with #!, try
     161     installing Perl in a directory with a shorter pathname.
     162
     163     Where do you keep publicly executable scripts? (~name ok)
     164     [/g/data/jh2/bw0729/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-skylake_avx512/gcc-8.3.1/perl-5.30.3-5ug3nuxo2vvgzvgvgz7
             agevwq6nuxsiq/bin]
     165     Directory /g/data/jh2/bw0729/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-skylake_avx512/gcc-8.3.1/perl-5.30.3-5ug3nuxo2v
             vgzvgvgz7agevwq6nuxsiq/bin doesn't exist.  Use that name anyway?

[...]

     898     cc -c -DPERL_CORE -D_REENTRANT -D_GNU_SOURCE -DAPPLLIB_EXP="/g/data/jh2/bw0729/spack/opt/spack/linux-cento
             s8-skylake_avx512/gcc-8.3.1/perl-5.30.3-5ug3nuxo2vvgzvgvgz7agevwq6nuxsiq/lib/perl5" -fwrapv -fno-strict-al
             iasing -pipe -fstack-protector-strong -I/g/data/jh2/bw0729/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-skylake_avx512/gc
             c-8.3.1/gdbm-1.18.1-xmpiec57yctvdwo6q5wcxao7hfpax3jd/include -D_LARGEFILE_SOURCE -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -D
             _FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -std=c89 -O2 -Wall -Werror=declaration-after-statement -Werror=pointer-arith -Wextra -Wc
             ++-compat -Wwrite-strings -fPIC pad.c
     899     cc -c -DPERL_CORE -D_REENTRANT -D_GNU_SOURCE -DAPPLLIB_EXP="/g/data/jh2/bw0729/spack/opt/spack/linux-cento
             s8-skylake_avx512/gcc-8.3.1/perl-5.30.3-5ug3nuxo2vvgzvgvgz7agevwq6nuxsiq/lib/perl5" -fwrapv -fno-strict-al
             iasing -pipe -fstack-protector-strong -I/g/data/jh2/bw0729/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-skylake_avx512/gc
             c-8.3.1/gdbm-1.18.1-xmpiec57yctvdwo6q5wcxao7hfpax3jd/include -D_LARGEFILE_SOURCE -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -D
             _FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -std=c89 -O2 -Wall -Werror=declaration-after-statement -Werror=pointer-arith -Wextra -Wc
             ++-compat -Wwrite-strings -fPIC pp_hot.c

[...]

See build log for details:
  /scratch/jh2/bw0729/tmp/spack-stage/spack-stage-perl-5.30.3-5ug3nuxo2vvgzvgvgz7agevwq6nuxsiq/spack-build-out.txt

==> Warning: Skipping build of openssl since perl failed
==> Warning: Skipping build of cmake since openssl failed
==> Warning: Skipping build of llvm since cmake failed
==> Warning: Skipping build of python since openssl failed
==> Warning: Skipping build of z3 since python failed
==> Warning: Skipping build of py-setuptools since python failed
==> Warning: Skipping build of perl-data-dumper since perl failed
[+] /g/data/jh2/bw0729/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-skylake_avx512/gcc-8.3.1/hwloc-2.2.0-bx7lrwpuohojng64n3lldbj6rbqfairx
==> Error: Installation of llvm failed.  Review log for details
```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
* **Spack:** 0.15.4-1568-0e6b818c5
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-centos8-cascadelake
<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
* [spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5413118/spack-build-out.txt)
* [spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5413119/spack-build-env.txt)
* [spack-configure-args.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5413120/spack-configure-args.txt)

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->
@naromero77  @trws

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [x] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
